A Moment of Redemption

A dim tavern, patrons laughing boisterously.  
Marmeladov, drunk and desperate, speaks passionately.  
Marmeladov: “He will forgive my Sonia, I know it!”  
  
Marmeladov: “Come forth, ye drunkards, ye weak ones!”  
  
Silence falls momentarily, then laughter erupts.  
Patron 1: “That’s his notion!”  
Patron 2: “Talked himself silly!”  

---  

A weary Marmeladov slumps on a bench.  
Exhausted, lost in his thoughts.  
Marmeladov: “We shall understand all things!”  
Patron 3: “A fine clerk he is!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marmeladov expresses a profound belief in divine forgiveness for all, including the marginalized and sinful, before succumbing to exhaustion and indifference from those around him.
